unnormalised: Okay, so someone asked about the common issues faced in Gastroenterology, right? Well, from what I've seen around in my family and neighborhood in Delhi, acidity and indigestion are super common. My uncle, for instance, suffers from chronic acidity and takes Gelusil quite often. He even consulted Dr. Sharma at AIIMS last month, who recommended some lifestyle changes and prescribed Pantoprazole 40mg.
normalised: Okay, so someone asked about the common issues faced in G-A-S-T-R-O-E-N-T-E-R-O-L-O-G-Y, right? Well, from what I've seen around in my family and neighborhood in Delhi, acidity and indigestion are super common. My uncle, for instance, suffers from chronic acidity and takes Gelusil quite often. He even consulted Doctor Sharma at A-I-I-M-S last month, who recommended some lifestyle changes and prescribed Pantoprazole forty milligram.

unnormalised: Another frequent problem is lactose intolerance. My cousin, Aisha, was diagnosed with it last year after experiencing severe discomfort after consuming dairy products. She now relies on lactose-free alternatives and has to carefully check food labels. It’s quite common these days, I think; maybe because we are now able to diagnose it better. Also, conditions like Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) are increasingly being recognized. I read somewhere that around 10-15% of the Indian population may have IBS, although many might not even know they have it and just put it down to "gas".

unnormalised: Then there’s the whole issue of gallstones. My neighbor had to undergo a laparoscopic cholecystectomy at Max Hospital after repeated bouts of pain. The surgery apparently cost him around Rs. 80,000, including hospital stay and doctor's fees. Thankfully, he’s feeling much better now. Liver-related issues are also unfortunately quite prevalent, often linked to lifestyle factors and sometimes even undiagnosed Hepatitis.
